snippet: The Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them.
abstract: Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them as part of $3.4 billion settlement over the Interior Department's mismanagement of Indian land royalties.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says Indian tribes do not have to reimburse the government for buying divided tribal land so it can be returned to them.

headline.main: Tribes Won’t Be Required to Reimburse Government
headline.print_headline: Tribes Won’t Be Required To Reimburse Government
